Abstract: The transition towards sustainable chemical manufacturing necessitates innovative approaches to reduce carbon emissions and enhance energy efficiency. Electrochemical manufacturing, particularly organic electrosynthesis, offers a promising pathway for the production of organic chemical commodities. This method leverages electricity, potentially sourced from renewable energy, to drive chemical transformations, thereby aligning with global decarbonization goals. This review explores recent advancements in electrochemical techniques for synthesizing key organic compounds, highlighting the integration of electrochemistry in traditional chemical manufacturing processes. Emphasis is placed on the scalability, economic viability, and environmental benefits of these electrochemical routes. By examining case studies and emerging technologies, this study underscores the potential of electrification in revolutionizing the chemical industry, paving the way for a more sustainable and resilient manufacturing landscape.
